name: Springhill Suites Fort Lauderdale Airport

reviews.text: This hotel caters to the cruise crowd. We arrived in Fort Lauderdale Thursday night for a Saturday sailing. It was great to be there with a few days to explore Fort Lauderdale. We actually flew into Miami (again cheaper) and rented a car for a day to drive up to Fort Lauderdale. This hotel was chosen mostly because we had free Marriott points and they offered free shuttle to the port. I recommend reserving a spot on the shuttle as soon as you check in. We asked for a room facing the parking lot (away from the highway) for quiet. Also we usually ask for a top floor, but with all the cruise passengers leaving at the same time we didn't want to fight for an elevator. There is a Kmart across the street. We went there for wine and bottled water (both are allowed on RCI). 2 bottles of wine per stateroom. And we just slapped a luggage tag on our $4 case of water and wha-lla it showed up in our stateroom. This hotel is fine. The pool area is okay, but small. Not the newest hotel we've stayed in but the price and convenience were right.
reviews.title: Free Port Shuttle and Free Points - 'nuf said

reviews.text: We checked in around 3:30 pm on a Sunday - staff was not warm but not rude either. I was upset though when I showered a few hours later - not inspecting the shampoo/conditioner - I jumped in and found myself w/ only 2 conditioners and no shampoo and I have a lot of hair and that was not F U N. GRRRR - it happens I guess.
reviews.title: Great deal (AAA) for 1 night stay predeparture FLL - nice pool and decent free breakfast

reviews.text: We had a king room w/ a love seat pullout. Shared TV on wall, sm. kitchenette w/ refridgerator.
reviews.title: Run-of-the-mill Budget Marriott Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: VERY LOUD HVAC - everytime the fan kicked on I woke up! all night I was mostly awake - could hear road noise too from highway. Flat whimpy pillows and for the pullout they only gave us sheets and a very thin blanket.
reviews.title: Good for a pre-cruise stay
Car Jacking
reviews.text: Some foods were already old and cold at 6:05 AM? leftovers??

The hotel itself is ok, a little dated but a place to sleep ,and breakfast is average. They have a shuttle service , but only goes at certain times. If you want to get to port early for a cruise they chare you $10 a head. I asked about taking a taxi, and was told it cost in excess of $30 ( really pushing their pay shuttle). At the end of my cruise took a taxi found it would only cost $16. I don't mind paying for things , but to lie about costs bothers me so I would not recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Would not stay again

reviews.text: A basic hotel near the cruise port, if that's what you're after. Clean and friendly, but over-run with cruisers. Here's a tip: bring your own case of Bud Light and drink it in the lobby, and you'll fit right in with everyone else 'cause that's what they were doing! Breakfast Saturday morning before the cruises was complete chaos. Shuttle to and from the airport was busy and crowded, but free.
reviews.title: "Cruisers" Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is near lots of chain restaurants and strip malls.
reviews.title: What a way to Relax after a cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent. Plenty of dining options within walking and driving distance. check in was easy as well as free transport to and from airport. Local area has great shopping plaza across and very spacious rooms. Really enjoyed our stay and great stop after returning from our cruise. I would stay there again under the same circumstances.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through priceline. We got in late from our flight, and the receptionist was extremely nice and made sure we had everything we needed. Our room didn't have any toiletries, but they stopped mopping the floors to go find some for us! GREAT service. The hotel was pretty standard and clean. Breakfast was great and had lots of options. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: just what we were looking for.

reviews.text: I've seen a lot of nice hotels from this brand - this was not one of them. Many South Florida hotels struggle to not be overtaken by the old, moldy smell that comes with lots of humidity. This hotel is losing that battle. The room was pretty beat up, and the clientele I saw you can tell it's a quick-stop hotel mostly for cruisers The price was right, so if you just need a cheap place to stay, could be a good option.
reviews.title: Dated hotel - average stay in South Florida

reviews.text: This is our 3rd stay at this property in 4 yrs....pre cruise
reviews.title: Another Great Visit
Stayed two separate nights this month
reviews.text: Safe...Clean....Quiet...Conveniant...
Good Price....Good Breakfast...
reviews.title: Family Trip at Hard Rock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very courteous....helpfull staff
reviews.title: Just What We Were Looking For

reviews.text: Used this hotel as a one night stopover. There was a complimentary shuttle from and to the airport, drivers of the shuttle left much to be desired. Check-in at the hotel was quick and friendly. Room was typical Springhill style, large comfortable bed, nice flat screen TV, free wifi, small kitchenette area, and very clean bathroom. Breakfast was complimentary and there was enough food to fill one up for hours. Check-out was also fast and friendly. There are many stores located within a one/two block area of the hotel and plenty of fast food restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice stopover hotel

reviews.text: Travel agent booked my husband, myself and friends of ours into this hotel as a stop over on our way to cruise. We were really disappointed upon arrival, the hotel is old, outdated and not clean. The elevator was so slow we decided to take the stairs....it was filthy dirty. Breakfast was included but the cutlery and dishes were paper and plastic with tables not cleaned. When we checked in the clerk was very unfriendly and rude. The rooms were large and the bed was comfortable however there were tiny insects crawling around the sink and bathroom area and ants in our friend's room. We were supposed to come back to this hotel after our cruise to extend our vacation however we called our travel agent to cancel and book us somewhere else. To make a long story shorter we ended up having to pay for the 2 nights as they would not cancel and stated it was non-refundable. We did not return and stayed at another hotel. Would not recommend this hotel may be ok as a stop over as it is close to cruise port and the shuttle is complimentary.
reviews.title: Possibly ok for stop over but not a vacation spot.

reviews.text: We stayed here one night prior to a transatlantic cruise. Free shuttle from the airport and to the cruise port were definitely a plus. Breakfast was ample with scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurts, cereals, breads, juices, etc. This is a family oriented hotel with a small pool & jacuzzi, so be prepared for lots of kids. Fast food restaurants were within easy walking distance and a shopping center nearby for any last minute shopping. Rooms were very nice with a separate desk & seating area, min-fridge, 2 queen beds, & combo tub/shower. Complimentary cold bottle of water upon arrival was appreciated.
reviews.title: Complimentary shuttle to cruise port

reviews.text: Hi, our family just stayed one night after our cruise to meet up with friends and catch our flight the following day. Upon arrival, the staff were great, they gave us breakfast, and even let us check in early. It was the great start our stay. The hotel room was spacious for the 5 of us. The hotel was relativley clean, there were lots of ants in the area prior to entering the pool area and the dining area.
reviews.title: Beware - Car break-ins at night - Steal luggage May 2013
Good hotel
reviews.text: DO NOT park your rental vehicle far from the doors and DO NOT put your luggage in your vehicle. 7 cars were broken into the night we stayed at the hotel. My husband put 3 of our luggages in the van (a rental vehicle) at 11:00 pm as we had to leave at 3:00 am, and when we went out at 3:00 am the back window of the van was smashed in and our luggage stolen.

aka: Springhill Suites Fort Lauderdale Airport Hotel
description: All suite, non-smoking Marriott hotel offering large spacious work space and sleeping area with pull-out sofa, microwave, refrigerator and microwave. Perfect location for a pre-cruise stay, layovers, long-term stay or a quick getaway. The hotel is convenient to all major highways, beaches, shopping, dining and entertainment. Includes scheduled transportation to/from Fort Lauderdale Airport. Complimentary transportation to Port Everglades is available upon request. Return transportation from the cruise port is also provided for a small fee.
